critical_issues: ❌ CRITICAL: No transaction costs - profits may disappear with realistic costs
❌ CRITICAL: No slippage modeled - unrealistic execution assumptions
❌ CRITICAL: No market impact - strategy may move prices in practice
warnings: ⚠️  ETHUSDT_1h.csv: 51.3% zero volume - yfinance data quality issue
⚠️  BTCUSDT_1h.csv: 52.2% zero volume - yfinance data quality issue
⚠️  SOLUSDT_1h.csv: 50.7% zero volume - yfinance data quality issue
⚠️  EURUSD_1h.csv: 100.0% zero volume - yfinance data quality issue
⚠️  USDJPY_1h.csv: 100.0% zero volume - yfinance data quality issue
⚠️  GBPUSD_1h.csv: 100.0% zero volume - yfinance data quality issue
⚠️  DATA SOURCE: yfinance has known accuracy issues for intraday data
⚠️  VOLUME DATA: Forex volume is synthetic, crypto volume often zero
⚠️  FDR CORRECTION: Benjamini-Hochberg not applied to cross-market analysis
⚠️  EFFECT SIZES: 121 significant correlations have |r| < 0.1 - statistically significant but practically meaningless
⚠️  GRANGER TESTS: May need 1000+ observations for reliable results
⚠️  SI SENSITIVITY: SI depends on arbitrary choices (window=168, n_agents=3)
⚠️  REGIME THRESHOLDS: 30/70 percentile thresholds are arbitrary
⚠️  STRATEGY SIMPLICITY: Only 3 simple strategies - may not capture market complexity
⚠️  FEATURE OVERLAP: Rolling windows create autocorrelation in features
⚠️  LOOK-AHEAD LEAKAGE: No purging/embargo between train/val/test splits
⚠️  UNEQUAL SAMPLES: Stock data has ~1,900 rows vs Crypto ~9,500 - comparison may be unfair
⚠️  TIMEZONE: Different markets have different trading hours - SI may not be comparable
⚠️  SHORT PERIOD: ~13 months of data may not capture full market cycles
⚠️  GEOGRAPHIC BIAS: Only US stocks tested - may not generalize globally
⚠️  SELECTION BIAS: Only most liquid assets - SI may not work for smaller assets
⚠️  REGIME DEPENDENCY: Results may be regime-specific
⚠️  LOW RETURNS: Average TEST return is only +0.09% - may be noise
